words.definition: To achieve something is to successfully do it after trying hard.
words.example: I was happy that I could achieve my goal.

words.definition: To advise someone is to tell them what to do.
words.example: My mother often advises people about their money.

words.definition: If something happens already, it happens before a certain time.
words.example: It is already time for the movie to start. Let’s go in.

words.definition: If something is basic, it is very simple or easy.
words.example: I learned some basic English skills in school today.

words.definition: A bit is a small amount of something.
words.example: I ate a bit of chocolate before I went to bed.

words.definition: To consider something means to think about it.
words.example: Pete didn’t like his job. He considered getting a new one.

words.definition: To destroy means to damage something so badly that it cannot be used.
words.example: The glass was destroyed.

words.definition: To entertain someone is to do something that they enjoy.
words.example: The clown entertained the kids at the party.

words.definition: If something is extra, it is more than what is needed.
words.example: The squirrel had extra nuts for the winter.

words.definition: A goal is something you work toward.
words.example: Her goal was to become a doctor.

words.definition: To lie is to say or write something untrue to deceive someone.
words.example: Whenever Pinocchio lied to his father, his nose grew.

words.definition: Meat is food made of animals.
words.example: This piece of meat I’m eating tastes very good.

words.definition: An opinion is a thought about a person or thing.
words.example: Meg gave me her opinion of my new dress.

words.definition: If something is real, it actually exists.
words.example: Some people don’t believe in ghosts because they aren’t real.

words.definition: To reflect is when a surface sends back light, heat, sound or an image.
words.example: Her face was reflected in the smooth lake.

words.definition: To regard someone or something is to think of them in a certain way.
words.example: The boy regards the girl as a good friend.

words.definition: To serve someone is to give them food or drinks.
words.example: He served us our drinks with a smile.

words.definition: A vegetable is a plant used as food.
words.example: Carrots are my favorite vegetable.

words.definition: A war is a big fight between two or more groups of people.
words.example: Many young men died in the war.

words.definition: If something is worth an amount of money, it costs that amount.
words.example: Our house is worth a lot of money.
